cards.desc:
Short description:
Basicly Mario Kart in space. Big open maps with multiple starships that all have different statistics. Multiple collectible powerups which help you take down/overtake the opponents. Possibility of always having a basic attack enabled to help people chase down the leader. The races will have players fly through big checkpoints. There could be many different encounters in space like: 
Asteroid fields
Enemy blockades which fire upon coming to close
Random starships controlled by AI's that fly around the map|
cards.name: Space Race
Physics based RPG - Physics based Action Adventure

data.text:
The game looks 2d but you're able to move "up" and "down" the screen and you'll be fighting of numerous enemies at a time. The goal is simple, beat up anyone who stands in your way using various fighting moves and get to the end of the stage.

You'd have 2 different fighters, each with their own (small) moveset and playstyle (Speed vs Power), when both the fighters' reaches zero it's game over.
A few examples of this kind of game would be Double Dragon Neon and 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tBVlQTNM86s
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6bEVWrtDSs0

The game plays in third person mode and has you collecting various objects throughout a stage. Only after having collected a certain amount of the necessary objects within the given time limit will you be able to progress to the next stage.

The game would have to be quite fast-paced as to keep up the tension, but the manner in which your character will move could differ greatly. The player could either do simple actions like running and jumping or more difficult movement options could be implemented like wall running, ledge climbing, flying..etc..etc...
A few examples of games like these would be Katamari Damacy or Spider-Man 2:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EP-OKD-7ITo

https://youtu.be/LicJF9RzNTw?t=12

data.text:
The game plays in first person mode and has you solving various puzzles by drawing certain shapes in the view. The catch is that you need to have a certain object in the view to interact with.

For example you'd have to draw a line from a lit torch to another unlit torch to lit it and solve a puzzle.
I think a game like this would be great for showing off grand visuals.
An example of a game like this would be Okami:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BRcfqu3hQkY

In the style of 'How to train a dragon'. You feed your dragon, train your dragon and fight other dragons with it. It sounds a lot like pokemon the way I just said it, but the actual game play will be more like War Thunder and has team play. You ride on your dragon and dogfight in the air with other dragons. Maybe you can unlock different types of dragons with different abilities. Some are fast some are slow but can fly really high and do heavy damage. Ofcourse you can improve and change the skillset of your dragon acording to it's type the more you 'train' it.

I don't know any good examples, but think the survival feeling of ARK: Survival evolved. Perhaps you're a scientist who does research on the survivability of the north pool. You catch fish, fight polarbears. Tame a couple of wolfs and make a sledge.

card.name: Space Race
card.desc:
Short description:
Basicly Mario Kart in space. Big open maps with multiple starships that all have different statistics. Multiple collectible powerups which help you take down/overtake the opponents. Possibility of always having a basic attack enabled to help people chase down the leader. The races will have players fly through big checkpoints. There could be many different encounters in space like: 
Asteroid fields
Enemy blockades which fire upon coming to close
Random starships controlled by AI's that fly around the map|

card.name: Choose Game
card.desc: When multiple game ideas have been posted vote on the game idea you like the most. The idea with the most votes will be the game we will be making

card.name: Make a git repository
card.desc: Make a git repository that all the members can access

card.name: GIT and Code conventions
card.desc: Determine the GIT and Code conventions that will be used during the project and put it in a .txt document on git

checkItems.name: Pillar can collide with other objects
Pillar has a mesh
Pillar has a texture
Camera can act upon user input.
Camera can make descision when to ignore user input.
Camera can rotate in worldspace according to user.
Can play with 2-4 players
Can attach controller to player
Keeps controller attached to player after player disconnects
Particle manager works on the GPU
Can give a position
Can give a duration
Can give an amount
Can give a direction
Can give a width
Can give a speed
move forward
turn left
turn right
brake
Controls are clearly shown to the player
Controls are working on the keyboard
Every button you can press is responsive and accurate
Brake slows you down to a stopping halt within a short time
When you crash you respawn shortly after you have crashed
The respawn point is a little behind the point where you originally crashed
An object has a position
An object has an inverse mass
An object has a velocity
An object has an acceleration
Different forces can influence the object
Physics can be attached to any object with colliders present in worldspace
The track has a startline
The track has a finishline
There are objects on the track to make the track more interesting (asteroids, rocks, loopings)
Track has a landscape with varying heights
Physics engine can detect when two objects collide and act upon it
Physics engine can handle a range of different primary shapes
Physics engine can differentiatie between OnEnter, OnStay and OnExit
Physics engine can decide whether the collision requires additional actions
The camera is in third person behind and slighty above the spaceship
